funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide equipment to three spaces for the Mountaineer Maker Space and Incubator to foster community-based entrepreneurship, support the growth or small businesses and to help with job creation and income generation. Additional funding includes $2,419 from Barbour County Community Foundation, $3,200 from West Virginia University, $1,500 from State Farm and $9,200 from Westminster Presbyterian Church. The project will create two jobs and save ten.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Barbour County Sheriffs Department to replace one of their aging vehicles with a 2021 Dodge 1500. The new police cruiser will be used for patrol and enforcement activities. The Barbour County Sheriffs Department currently has eight cruisers ranging from 2013 to 2019 and 104,000 miles to 42,000 miles. The fleet consists of four trucks, three Durangos and one Charger. The Barbour County Sheriffs Department provides public safety and law enforcement assistance 24 hours per day. Having dependable, life-saving equipment is critical for the department to serve all residents at a moments notice. Police cruisers are essential to the effectiveness of their operations in the community.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help purchase and install a 20 kilowatt solar array. This investment will save $2,296 per year and will replace 26,264 kilowatt hours (120 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 266-kW solar array. Mountaineer Behavioral Health, PLLC is a private drug treatment center in a rural area. This project will realize $31,778 per year in savings and will replace 261,000 kWh (10 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power 21 homes.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renew and replace existing infrastructure forthe Washington Pike Public Service District (PSD). The utility consists of 38 miles of water mains, 49 fire hydrants, two pumping stations and three water storage tanks to service 1,371 residential and 12 commercial customers. The PSD purchases water from the City of Follansbee for the low-lying Cross Creek area, and from the City of Wellsburg for the higher ridge service areas. A connection between these two service areas would provide a backup water supply for each location. The PSD owns land across the street from the existing office and would like to construct a new office and maintenance garage on the site. It would also like to replace the older meters and retrofit the newer meters with radio read units, mobile reading units, and software. A few areas of water main that have had several repairs for leaks will be replaced, gate valves willbe added to the lines, and the pumping stations willbe updated with this project. The PSD would also like to update the telemetry currently in use with new technology that is more accurate and easier to repair.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to plan the business model design and feasibility of Cultural Wealth Hub, support emerging entrepreneurs and facilitate technical assistance and resources to support existing businesses recovering from the pandemic.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase video conferencing units to allow remote hearings in Calhoun County, West Virginia, to take place. Over the past year, it has been realized that due to COVID-19 we can expect remote hearings to become the norm. By purchasing the video conferencing equipment, hearings can take place in nearly empty courtrooms and follow current COVID-19 guidance. Courthouses are expected to continue to have remote hearings even once COVID-19 guidelines are lifted. The current technology is unable to integrate with most of the current equipment, and this has created a roadblock that can only be resolved by upgrading these units.

project_name: Norman Ridge & Bull River Water Extension
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct approximately 65,000 linear feet of various sizes of waterline. They will also repair water storage tanks and purchase equipment and necessary appurtenances to serve 77 users in the proposed service areas. Fire protection capabilities are planned for the majority of the proposed service areas. Certain portions of the existing distribution system will require upgrading to accommodate planned fire flows and to eliminate excessive maintenance requirements. The proposed improvements are planned to be in conformance with the American Iron and Steel provisions of the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2017 (Section 746, Division A of Title VII). No modifications to the source, pumping, or treatment physical plant are planned or necessary.

project_name: 2021 DCI Wastewater Treatment Plant Solids Handling Upgrade Project
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by White Oak Public Service District to make numerous upgrades to their wastewater treatment plant. Among the upgrades are two chlorine contact chambers, one non-potable water system, one post disinfection aeration system, two sludge return waste pumps, one dewatering building, two drilled potable water wells, one maintenance building, one control building, and one auxiliary power generator. There will be no change to the sewer collection system or the office building.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITIES AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Romney to purchase a dump truck with a snow plow to maintain city streets and assist in daily operations.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the City of Romney to purchase K9 training equipment to train their existing, untrained K9 in drug detection, criminal and missing person tracking, and criminal apprehension.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the City of Romney to purchase a Stout zero turn riding mower to mow multiple locations including town hall, two parks, the community pool, the fire department, and walking trails. The town currently has no working mower of this size and scope. Their current mower has broken down and is not fixable.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the the city of Romney to purchase a new airless paint striping machine for use in line work on city streets and parking lots, plus the painting of city curbs. The city will also purchase two walk behind mowers to replace older models and lessen the need to transfer mowers from location to location.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Romney Law Enforcement Department to purchase five Kenwood NX-5300K5 UHF (380-470 MHz) portable radios with speaker microphones. These radios are essential to the effectiveness of their operations in the community.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a 2020 patrol interceptor with all relevant equipment to replace a 2009 Dodge Charger patrol vehicle. Romney recently annexed 20 new homes into the citys limits and needs a newer model patrol vehicle to serve this area.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Romney to purchase a 2021 Ford F150 4x4 service truck to be used daily by the citys public works department. The city currently utilizes a 2004 pickup with over 156,000 miles.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Romney to purchase three radar units for their police vehicles. They currently have one police vehicle with no radar unit and two other vehicles with radar units over 10 and 25 years old.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Romney to purchase a new Bobcat Skid Steer, a new Trac Vac Vacuum System, and a new 325-gallon Direct Application System to spray anti-icing liquids onto road surfaces. The current skid steer is under a lease agreement which expired in October 2020. The city does not currently have access to their own Trac Vac system to clear the roads and ditches of leaves and debris, and they rely on and pay for a private entity to clear debris. The city also has no system to pre-treat roadways for ice and snow prevention.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Romney to retrofit existing vehicles with rear cargo and window screens for prisoner containment. They will also equip an existing vehicle with a bumper guard. The city currently does not have enough fully equipped vehicles to transport prisoners to the regional jail system.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make permanent repairs to their wastewater collection treatment system. These repairs are needed to eliminate the sources of inflow and infiltration that are identified in service lines and laterals. The service lines and laterals which are dead ends in the system and no longer in use will be exposed and capped. Plugs are currently being used, and occasionally these plugs are dislodged by hydraulic pressure causing flow to be in excess of the design capacity. Additionally, the existing pumps in Pump Stations 1 and 2 will be replaced.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make water distribution system upgrades. New water lines will be installed along County Route 20/1, County Route 20/2, and down Center Street to County Route 20. The new water line will provide fire protection in the New Cumberland area. The city plans to replace the existing customer meters with a cellular read metering system to reduce time spent on reading meters. The project will also provide improvements to the water treatment plant, such as new equipment in the chlorine room, a new sink with test ports, a new fiberglass door, and a new hot water tank. This project also proposes to rehabilitate the existing 500,000-gallon water storage tank. A new 300,000-gallon water storage tank and a new 100,000-gallon water storage tank are proposed to be built to replace the existing 300,000-gallon and 100,000-gallon storage tanks which will be demolished. Upon completion of the tank rehabilitation and construction, a new security fence system will be constructed at the tank sites.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Hardy County Commission to purchase 50 self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA) oxygen tanks to be utilized by fire departments throughout Hardy County. The fire departments within Hardy County are currently utilizing SCBA oxygen tanks that are near expiration.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Hardy County Sheriffs Department to purchase two new police vehicles with all necessary police equipment. The sheriff departments 13 officers currently provide service to 582 square miles of mountainous terrain.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Moorefield Volunteer Fire Company to purchase a 2020 Chevy Silverado crew cab with all necessary equipment. The new vehicle will also be utilized to tow a rescue boat and a utility terrain vehicle. It will replace an older 1995 Chevy Suburban.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the town of Moorefield purchase a 2021 Hino XL8 single-axle dump truck with hydraulic and spreader controls and snow plow. The town will also purchase a 2021 Ram 1500 crew cab 4x4 pickup for street maintenance. The town currently utilizes a 1994 model dump truck and a 1998 Ford F150, both beyond their useful life and often requiring mechanical maintenance.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase three patrol vehicles for the Moorefield Law Enforcement Department. The department currently employs nine officers who currently rely on seven vehicles.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Hardy County Public Service District construct a facility that will house the main office and maintenance shop. Their office and shop facility were severely damaged by flooding during a June 2018 natural disaster. As a result, the district has been forced to operate out of a small temporary construction trailer for over two years. The site for the new facility is a 4.88-acre parcel within the Robert C. Byrd Hardy County Industrial Park located just outside the eastern city limits of the town of Moorefield. The new 6,300-square-foot facility will consist of a 2,000-square-foot office area for administrative staff and board members and a 4,300-square-foot garage area for maintenance and storage of parts, vehicles, and equipment. Since there are electric, gas, water, sewer, telephone, cable, and fiber optic utilities adjacent to the proposed site a two-hour fire-rated wall will separate the two areas.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 46-kW solar array. RSS Ocean Mines RD, LLC is a family-owned storage unit company in a rural area. This project will realize $5,231 per year in savings and will replace 51,723 kWh (80 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to powerfour homes.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 7.15 kilowatt solar array. Silver Mist Stables is a family owned equine farm. This project will realize $1,663 per year in savings and replace 8,165 kilowatt hours (100 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power a significant portion of one home.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to extend sewer service to the Clarksburg Country Club area and the Laurel Park area. It will include roughly 85,385 linear feet of new line of various diameters. Some of the new line will be gravity and some will be force main. This section will also include 180 manholes, five duplex lift stations, three duplex grinder lift stations, and seven grinder pumps. The sewage from this new collection system will be treated at the districts existing wastewater treatment plant at West Milford. The contracted treatment of sewer by Bridgeport and Clarksburg will continue for the sections they have served in the past. The existing system will continue as it did in the past.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Energy Audits and Renewable Energy Development Grants
funding_code: RENEWABLE ENERGY DEVLP ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used throughout the state of West Virginia to conduct ten or more renewable energy assessments for rural small businesses and agricultural producers. These reports will provide analysis to make renewable energy investments to these operations. The purpose of this funding program is to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems and making energy-efficiency improvements toits operations.

funding_code: RRH-NONSUBSIDIZED-SEC538 GUARANTEED
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development loan guarantee will be used to assist in the construction ofThurston Landing II, a senior multifamily housing complex in St. Albans, WV. This project will consist of a three-story residential building with 32 one-bedroom units restricted to seniors age 55 and older and eight, three-bedroom units for general occupancy. Common amenities will include a community room and kitchen.

funding_code: RRH-NONSUBSIDIZED-SEC538 GUARANTEED
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to rehabilitate Mill Creek Landing, a family multi-family housing complex in Charleston, West Virginia. The project will go through significant rehabilitation and improve the living conditions for all the current and future tenants. This project has a total of eight one-bedroom, 32 two-bedroom, and eight three-bedroom units.

The project will go through significant rehabilitation and improve the living conditions for all the current and future tenants. This project has a total of 88 one-bedroom units housed in an eight-story high rise residential building. All units currently benefit from a 20-year Housing Assistance Payment contract and receive project-based Section 8 subsidy.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the McDowell County Commission to purchase 12 Panasonic rugged laptops for sheriffs vehicles. The rugged, lightweight laptops easily detach to become a 10.1 inch tablet. The laptop and tablet combination is fully communicative with mobile broadband, and the display can be viewed in bright sunlight. The current Sheriffs vehicle laptops are eight years old, slow, and sometimes unresponsive. They are also unable to communicate with mobile broadband.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the McDowell County Commission to purchase 12 Panasonic rugged laptops for sheriffs vehicles. The rugged, lightweight laptops easily detach to become a 10.1 inch tablet. The laptop and tablet combination is fully communicative with mobile broadband, and the display can be viewed in bright sunlight. The current Sheriffs vehicle laptops are eight years old, slow, and sometimes unresponsive. They are also unable to communicate with mobile broadband.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase video conferencing units to allow remote hearings in McDowell County, West Virginia, to take place. Over the past year, it has been realized that due to COVID-19 we can expect remote hearings to become the norm. By purchasing the video conferencing equipment, hearings can take place in nearly empty courtrooms and follow current COVID-19 guidance. Courthouses are expected to continue to have remote hearings even once COVID-19 guidelines are lifted. The current technology is unable to integrate with most of the current equipment, and this has created a roadblock that can only be resolved by upgrading these units.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for the purchase and installation of a 15 kilowatt solar array. Pops in Glenwood is a family owned convenience store in Mason County. This project will realize $2,127 per year in savings and replace 18,500 kilowatt hours (45 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power a significant portion of one home.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Bluefield to purchase a new, medium duty 4x4 truck with versalift. The truck will service traffic lights, roadway clearance, seasonal decorations, and anything that requires a safe vertical mobility platform. They currently utilize a 2006 model year bucket truck with over 175,000 miles.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the city of Bluefield to purchase a vacuum leaf collector for the Public Works Department. The unit is a model ALC 30-30, a 74 horsepower Kohler 2504TCR with optional equipment which is a pull behind unit. The city currently uses a 1993 Volvo model that has 131,958 miles and is in need of constant repairs.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: RESCUE AND AMBULANCE SERVICE - EQUIPMENT BUILDING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase one new X series manual monitor and defibrillator and five automated external defibrillators (AED) with covers. The fire department isresponsible for over three-square miles of streets and neighborhoods within the city limits as well as an additional 12,000 residents within a mutual aid agreement the city has with surrounding departments within Mercer County. Having dependable, life-saving equipment is critical for the department to serve all residents at a moments notice. A new defibrillator and AED equipment are necessary to provide an adequate level of protection for citizens within the departments service area.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a new excavator unit for the city of Princetons public works department. This equipment will allow the city to continue to adequately maintain streets and underground infrastructure. The city of Princetons public works department is responsible for maintaining over three square miles of streets, sidewalks, and underground lines and pipes. The citys current excavator is almost 20 years old and requires frequent maintenance just to keep it in operating condition.

borrower_name: West Virginia University Research Corporation on behalf of WVU
funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) TAT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used through the ACTAT Program, West Virginia University, University of Kentucky, and University of Tennessee-Knoxville employ various strategies to provide customized technical assistance on-site at water facilities, regional in-person and virtual trainings, and develop and distribute educational materials in their respective states. Each state university will continue to communicate with appropriate state agencies and other service providers in identifying utilities in need of immediate assistance to address water and wastewater issues. Training and technical assistance is directed towards communities with less than 5,000 customers and a focus is on those with less than 2,500. They will offer regional training courses, on-site training workshops, and hands on technical assistance if needed. The regional module trainings will be deployed through an online platform in order to allow multiple utilities to participate. The utility specific training will focus on at least 2 utilities based on results from the regional module trainings and the utility focused assistance will focus on three additional utilities and will provide a more hands-on, technical approach to implement specific goals identified in the regional module training and utility specific training.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to correct excessive inflow and infiltration of their collection and transmission system. The project will include removal and replacement or repair of sewer lines and manholes in some locations. They will install a new 400 kilowatt diesel generator with a 600 ampere automatic transfer switch. They will install snow melt heat trace cable on top of the walls of the aeration tank and clarifiers or on the roof over the aeration tank and clarifiers. They will also construct a new 44 feet x 30 feet garage to house equipment presently being stored outdoors.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist each ultimate recipient in identifying and developing a funding strategy for one impactful community project in each Mon Forest Town. Communities in the Monongahela National Forest have been seeking ways to diversify their local economies in the wake of the decline of the coal economy. The Region 4 Planning and Development Council will be helping to identify ten community projects across the region to come up with a preliminary plan to make an application for funding, a funding strategy, and an application if the project is ready to move forward.

project_name: 2021 DCI Water Treatment Plant Improvement Project
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade Craigsville Public Service Districts water treatment plant and construct a dedicated water distribution line from the water treatment plant to its tanks. The Craigsville Public Service District owns and operates a surface water treatment plant that went into service in 1962. The water treatment plant averages 14 hours per day of operation to meet an average daily demand of 425,000 gallons per day.

The Craigsville Public Service District owns and operates a surface water treatment plant that went into service in 1962. The water treatment plant averages 14 hours per day of operation to meet an average daily demand of 425,000 gallons per day.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide distance learning technology and telemedicine stations for each of Clay Countys six schools. Distance learning technology will be utilized to provide virtual learning experiences for students across all grade levels, as well as expand opportunities for students to participate in advanced and college level courses not available at their home schools. Telemedicine stations will permit students and their families to confer with medical and mental health professionals at each school-based wellness center. This project will benefit approximately 2,000 residents in Clay County, West Virginia.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade telecommunications equipment at seven facilities at Glenville State College in central West Virginia. The equipment will enable the college to connect with dual-credit students at Gilmer County High School, Braxton County High School, Calhoun County High School, Clay County High School, Ridgewood High School and Webster County High School. Funds will also be used to purchase laptops so students can access online classes. In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the college will establish courses either exclusively online or in a hybrid method in which one portion of the instruction will be delivered on campus and the other portion will be delivered via electronic communications.

borrower_name: Lincoln County Primary Care Center, Inc.
funding_code: DLT GRANTS - CARES ACT - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to implement a distance learning system linking the Lincoln Primary Care Center to 13 sites. Continuing education and training opportunities will be provided to increase the pool of qualified medical professionals serving Lincoln, Boone, Kanawha, Logan and Mingo counties. The project also is expected to improve the retention of medical staff.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to establish distance learning systems at Berkeley Springs High School, Warm Springs Middle School, Warm Springs Intermediate School, Widmyer Elementary School, Paw Paw School and Pleasant View Elementary School. The project is expected to help 2,232 students and 202 teachers in Morgan County.

borrower_name: New River Community and Technical Colleg
funding_code: DLT GRANTS - CARES ACT - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will establish distance learning technology for New River Community and Technical College to expand and modernize its Interactive Video Network system across seven West Virginia counties. The project will provide services to high schools, medical facilities and a technology center. The enhanced network will increase access to Internet service and post-secondary educational programs across the region; and expand technical research and medical research opportunities.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS- CARES ACT - MEDICAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide telehealth services in Floyd, Johnson, Lawrence, Martin and Pike counties in Kentucky; Cabell, Mingo, Jackson and Logan counties in West Virginia; Gallia, Lawrence and Scioto counties in Ohio; and Buchanan County in Virginia. Each site will have a dedicated telehealth room equipped with a large interactive touchscreen monitor, computer, camera and printer. Each hub or hub/end-user site will have two dedicated providers who will be provide telehealth services to patients at end-user sites. This project also will provide substance misuse treatment services.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase distance learning supplies that will connect students K-7 grade and teachers, K-12 grade with Microsoft Surface Go 2 and Microsoft Surface Pro 7 devices. Pocahontas County Board of Education will facilitate remote and blended learning, expand capacity of educators with technology to support their ability to teach across campuses and inter-classroom co-teaching efforts, provide remote options for professional development and training for educators, and expand student focused mental health telemedicine capabilities in partnership with Youth Health Services, Inc. The project will benefit approximately 3,000 residents in rural West Virginia.

funding_code: TELEMEDICINE- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the information technology (IT) infrastructure at 33 Rainelle Medical Center sites. Additions will include hardware and software so the center can continue to meet the needs of residents in seven counties in southern West Virginia and keep them safe during the COVID-19 pandemic. The upgrades will enable the center to improve remote monitoring and treatment of patients with chronic diseases.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund the "Bridges to Degrees" project that creates pathways to postsecondary education for rural high school students by providing high-quality distance learning through live-streamed, synchronous dual enrollment courses offered at Shepherd University, located in the Eastern Panhandle of West Virginia. Funding will outfit Jefferson High School in Shenandoah Junction, West Virginia and Martinsburg High School in Martinsburg, West Virginia with the technology needed to engage in these distance learning courses and equips the university campus with the hardware necessary to deliver these interactive courses. The university proposes to provide distance learning through synchronous live-streamed dual enrollment courses to over 400 eligible high school students per calendar year.

borrower_name: West Virginia Higher Education Policy Co
funding_code: DLT GRANTS - SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase distance learning equipment that will develop a state-wide network that will provide an interactive telecommunications link between Hub and End users. The project will increase the availability of opioid and substance abuse prevention programs, establish the base of a statewide synchronous interactive distance learning network, expand the availability of college courses to rural communities, improve retention and graduation rates of college students, expand educational opportunities for high schools, improve academic achievement and college readiness for high schools, and increase community resources. The West Virginia Higher Education Policy Commission will serve as the Hub of the project and will serve approximately 5,600 residents in rural West Virginia.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to establish the Mountain Medicine Trail to increase revenue and job creation for non-timber forest product producers and related businesses as well as offering training and technical assistance.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to create, implement and assessment of a comprehensive marketing strategy with technical assistance provided by a West Virginia marketing firm and graphic designers to bring economic growth to the area. ll be provided. The project will creating 20 jobs and saving 5 jobs.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate and expand the Pocahontas Memorial Hospital, located in Pocahontas County. The project will expand the rear and left side of the building to add needed space. Administrative offices and the front entrance will expand slightly and the creation of one operating room will be an improvement to the current emergency department. This proposed surgical suite will be serviced by a minimal, but necessary, addition of pre/post operational beds, staffing support areas, anesthesia workroom and storage, as well as a small central sterile storage area. It is anticipated to be located immediately adjacent to the existing emergency department so that its area and beds can be utilized in cases of multiple patients, such as a bus accident or similar catastrophe. Other departments to receive renovations and expansions include the pharmacy, radiology and lab, information technology, materials management, and the dietary department. In total, approximately 11,500 square feet of new structure will be added to the existing hospital.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Hospital Development Company renovate their current structure to modernize their emergency department, create a new urgent care and walk-in clinic, and relocate the MRI machine and administrative offices. The hospital will also expand their current footprint by the construction of a new medical office building adjacent to their current structure to host a primary care clinic, specialty clinics, expand the therapy department, and provide community health services. The hospital is a not-for-profit acute care hospital providing acute inpatient, emergency, long-term nursing care, and physician clinic medical services to the residents of Roane County and surrounding areas.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a law enforcement vehicle. The vehicle is necessary for the ongoing operations of the Roane County Sheriff Department. The department employs seven deputies to carry out the duties required by West Virginia Code. The department covers an area of over 459 square miles of very rural terrain. Having reliable and safe transportation is crucial to the ongoing functions of the department.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase video conferencing units to allow remote hearings in Roane County, West Virginia, to take place. Over the past year, it has been realized that due to COVID-19 we can expect remote hearings to become the norm. By purchasing the video conferencing equipment, hearings can take place in nearly empty courtrooms and follow current COVID-19 guidance. Courthouses are expected to continue to have remote hearings even once COVID-19 guidelines are lifted. The current technology is unable to integrate with most of the current equipment, and this has created a roadblock that can only be resolved by upgrading these units.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve service to current customers and provide service to new customers in Marion and Monongalia counties in West Virginia. The Districts system maintains approximately 50 miles of main water distribution lines, six water storage tanks, and five booster stations. The project will upgrade water lines along Halleck Road to relieve high pressure issues and increase pumping flow capacity to the water storage tanks. The project will also extend approximately 3,000 feet of four-inch and six-inch water line and install a fire hydrant and a below ground pressure reducing station along Gillespie Road.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Monumental Public Service District replace waterlines in areas along Finch Run, Moody Run, Davy Run, Gilboa Road, Paw Paw Creek, Laurel Run, Bethel Run, Little Dunkard Mill, and several shorter sidelines. This project will replace approximately 161,000 linear feet of smaller diameter distribution lines with new larger diameter waterlines. Most of the waterline replacements that are six-inches or greater in diameter will be capable of supporting fire flow; therefore, 63 new fire hydrant assemblies will be included in this project. A 505,000-gallon water storage tank will replace the Gilboa Road tank, the Moores Auction Barn tank, the Bethel Hill tank, and the Buttermilk tank. The new, centrally located 505,000-gallon water tank will have an overflow elevation nearly 36 feet higher than the current four tanks. This will better serve customers at higher elevations. All customers along the replacement waterlines will also receive replacement meter settings and radio-read meters.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to enable the Public Service District to provide both public drinking water and fire protection by extending its water distribution south from Boreman Elementary along Route 18 to Centerville and Alma. The source of the water will be the Davenport Well Field along the Ohio River, which has ample capacity to supply the service area. The Public Service District will construct a new booster station at the end of the existing system. A new storage tank will be constructed to serve this area with drinking water and fire protection. The service area is currently plagued by dry private wells from a poor aquifer that creates water shortages during dry times. There are currently no fire hydrants in the project area.

project_name: Phase VIII Water System Extensions & Improvements
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install 10 waterline extensions to potentially reach 166 new customers in unserved areas of the Adrian Public Service District and Randolph County. The project will also include several upgrades to the existing distribution system. There are two new water booster pump stations and two new water storage tanks associated with the portion of this project that will extend water service to the community of Pickens. The other proposed new service areas within the Public Service District boundary will be served by gravity flow from current tanks. Overall, this new project will consist of approximately 161,000 lineal feet of various size waterlines, two new water storage tanks, three new booster pump stations, three existing booster pump station upgrades, and four pressure reducing stations.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to replace undersized and outdated lines in the German Ridge and Dickson areas of the Northern Distribution System. These lines will be replaced with 8-inch diameter lines that will provide fire flow while reducing water loss and operation and maintenance costs associated with leak repairs. The project will include installation of supervisory control and data acquisition additions, automatic flushing equipment, tank cleaning, installation of tank mixers, and pressure relief valve upgrades.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to extend a sewer system to the Upper Glade area. The Upper Glade area is currently served by inadequate private sewage treatment systems or no system at all that has resulted in raw sewage being discharged into an unknown tributary of the Gauley River. With this project, a maximum of 161 septic systems can be eliminated and provided more consistent, centralized treatment for wastewater. The project will also extend service lines to the Camp Caesar area which will allow the wastewater from the camp to be routed to the main plant for treatment and eliminate the existing treatment pond at the camp.

Cardinal Construction is a construction company located in Barboursville, West Virginia. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 12-kW solar array. This project will realize $1,912 per year in savings and will replace 14,930 kWh (44 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power one home.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make energy efficiency improvements with the purchase and installation of LED lighting throughout a manufacturing facility. BEK Inc. is a business that manufacturers bolt and metal fasteners nationwide. This project will realize $13,424 per year in savings, and will replace 134,173 kilowatt hours (kWh) (50 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power 11 homes.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address ongoing inflow and infiltration issues throughout their collection system. This project will improve the sanitary sewer collection system to reduce inflow and infiltration issues, reroute force mains, and add another lift station to pump to Salt Rock Public Service District. This project will eliminate the need for the sanitary sewer overflows and create capacity for future growth within and around Milton. Additionally, this project will construct an extension of the collection system roughly one mile east along Route 60 to provide service to approximately twenty new commercial and residential customers.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address ongoing inflow and infiltration issues throughout their collection system. This project will improve the sanitary sewer collection system to reduce inflow and infiltration issues, reroute force mains, and add another lift station to pump to Salt Rock Public Service District. This project will eliminate the need for the sanitary sewer overflows and create capacity for future growth within and around Milton. Additionally, this project will construct an extension of the collection system roughly one mile east along Route 60 to provide service to approximately twenty new commercial and residential customers.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Donna Richards crop and horse farm in Calhoun County. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 16-kW solar array. This project will realize $1,646 per year in savings and will replace 16,502 kWh (100 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power one home.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support phase 2 construction of the Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center. This phase will include construction of two floors, a new lab, a kitchen/cafeteria, a lobby, and a heliport in the parking lot. Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center is a 60-year-old hospital structure that has had multiple issues over the past few years. Improvements are planned for completion in four phases. Phase 2 will provide additional space for better functionality and necessary health services for nearly 8,000 people in the area.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a law enforcement vehicle and equipment for the Calhoun County Sheriffs Department. The Calhoun County Commission will provide the required matching funds to purchase the vehicle and needed equipment. They plan to purchase a 2022 utility all-wheel-drive vehicle which will be a first responder unit for law enforcement activities throughout Calhoun County. This new vehicle will replace one of the high mileage vehicles in their fleet. The department must have reliable vehicles in order to respond immediately to emergency calls.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center with the first phase of construction of their rural health clinic. This phase will include installation of new water and sewer lines. The current water and septic systems are failing. This has resulted in the closure of various parts of the facility and thus a lack of health care services. Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center is a 60-year-old hospital structure that has had multiple issues over the past few years. Improvements are planned for completion in four phases.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist with the first phase of construction of Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center. Phase one will add new water and sewer lines. Minnie Hamilton Health Care Center is a 60-year-old hospital structure that has had multiple issues over the past few years. The current water and septic systems are failing. This has resulted in the closure of various parts of the facility and thus a lack of health care services. This rural health clinic serves a population of nearly 8,000 people.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Oak Hills Properties, LLC., to purchase the Comfort Inn located in Oak Hill. The facility will provide access to travelers in a region that has a growing tourism industry.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a four-wheel drive law enforcement vehicle with all the necessary equipment. Smithers has three equipped cars utilized by a 24/7 staff. The officers patrol the city of Smithers as well as three miles of Route 60 going through and beyond town. The officers also provide backup support for the city of Montgomery and the Fayette County Sheriffs Department. This vehicle will replace an aging vehicle in their fleet with more than 200,000 miles and needs repairs that would cost more than the vehicles value. This project will provide a safe vehicle for the officers that support the community.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a Ford emergency response vehicle and equipment to outfit the vehicle. The city of Glenvilles Law Enforcement Department currently employs three full time officers and has a fleet of two cruisers. The department provides public safety and law enforcement assistance approximately 24 hours per day and having reliable equipment is critical. The department serves approximately 1,900 residents within their corporate limits, but also responds to emergency calls to assist the Gilmer County Law Enforcements office and the West Virginia State Law Enforcement outside the city of Glenville. This outside area includes one Federal Correctional Facility which houses approximately 1,600 inmates, Gilmer County Schools, Glenville State College, and the Department of Homeland Security Correctional Officer Academy for the State of West Virginia. In order to efficiently respond to emergency calls in the protection of lives and property of the citizens within the community, a third outfitted cruiser is essential to accommodate the effectiveness of the departments operations.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Greenbrier County PSD No 2 to upgrade their waste water treatment plant. The project also proposes to eliminate two air injection lift stations in the Quinwood area. The two air injection lift stations are planned to be replaced with an upgraded gravity collection system and one new centrally located submersible lift station. In addition, the project will rehab outdated lift stations with new pumps and valves.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade their waste water treatment plant. The project also proposes to eliminate two air injection lift stations in the Quinwood area. The two air injection lift stations are planned to be replaced with an upgraded gravity collection system and one new centrally located submersible lift station. The project includes the rehabilitation of eight lift stations which includes installation of new submersible pumps, and valves.

funding_code: (SECD) (COMBO L&G) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the City of Lewisburg to make improvements to their water system. The system is nearly 40 years old, and without this project, the water system would eventually fail and leave the city with no water. The project will include new intake structure, water treatment plant improvements, a new water storage tank, and demolition of the existing water storage tanks and booster stations. The project will also include installation of new water distribution system piping throughout the system and sludge processing equipment in the treatment plant filter building. This additional funding will be used to complete the project.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make permanent repairs to the Town of Tunneltons sewer collection system. Repairs are needed to eliminate the sources of inflow and infiltration that are identified in service lines and laterals that are dead ends in the system and no longer in use. Another proposed improvement will be the modification of the already existing Tunnelton wastewater treatment plant. In addition, two pump stations will be replaced, and a floating cover will be installed on the surface of the polishing pond to block sunlight and limit algae growth. This project will improve service to 142 residential users, four commercial users, and eight public users.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address needed renovation to West Milfords water system. The removal of the exterior paint coating on the tank will consist of pressure washing, then spot priming any areas that need touched up. An application of a new exterior paint will restore the integrity of the tank coating. In addition to the tank painting, renovating the valve vault for structural integrity and functionality will allow for safer operation of the water system. The addition of a radio-read meter system will provide more efficient, accurate, and prompt readings of customer water usage in the system. Adding a new western master meter will enable pit water to pass through the West Milford water system, lessening the amount of "dead water" on that side of the system and allowing another entry point for water to flow into the system in the event of an emergency. Replacing the five fire hydrants will provide better fire protection in those areas

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the City of Stonewood to correct several problem areas in their sewer system. These corrective measures include replacing the aging and failing portions of the collection system and upgrading one of the pump stations. These issues were identified throughout the city and have caused problems for the city and its residents. Each section of line will be upgraded to account for more users, old pipe, and adequate size for flow requirements. During the smoke test, smoke surfaced in residents yards and inside their houses, creating a potential for a system failure. The project is proposing to replace portions of the system with initial problem areas identified. These areas include the main interceptor on Water Street as well as sections on Woodland Avenue, Water Street, Elk Street, Route 58 Cost Avenue, Powell Avenue, Maple Avenue, Walnut Avenue, Stout Street, Gordan Street, Lightner Street, Southern Street, and Grasselli Street. The project also proposes to replace the existing pump station on Route 58 Cost Avenue just east of the city. This pump station is undersized and in need of being replaced with a larger pump station. Finally, the proposed project will install a new section of force main on the western side of the city. The force main will tie into the existing pump station and transfer sewer flows to the capped line in Nutter Fort. The new force main will be buried along the embankment on the western side of the Elk River, instead of crossing the Elk River above ground.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase 20 Mindray N1 and N15 monitors along with the new software and licenses required to use the devices. These new devices will replace their outdated equipment. This new equipment will be used in the Emergency Department, Intensive Care Unit, and Acute Care Units which have seen an increase in patients throughout the COVID-19 pandemic due to the specialized care required. The devices enable monitoring of vital signs, including oxygen saturation, carbon dioxide, arterial pressure, and heart rhythm. The hospital serves Lewis and Gilmer counties.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase two law enforcement vehicles to replace aging cruisers in their fleet. The two vehicles purchased will be custom outfitted with lights, consoles, and brackets to hold radio equipment for law enforcement official use. The department currently employs six officers and has a fleet of four cruisers. The city of Westons law enforcement provides public safety and assistance 24-hours per day. Having dependable life-saving equipment is critical for the department to serve the residents of the entire Weston area at a moments notice. Dependable and fully equipped cruisers are essential to the effectiveness of their operations in the community.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to establish a revolving loan fund to support small businesses to fund their operating expenses or to provide capital improvements that will lead to growth and expansion. A $7,606 applicant contribution will be part of the project as well as a $9,000 third-party contribution from Marion Regional Development Corporation. As a result of this project, 22 jobs will be saved and 15 jobs will be created.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 64-kilowatt (kW) solar array. Climate Controlled Storage is a family-owned storage facility near Fairmont. This project will realize $7,974 per year in savings and will replace 73,838 kilowatt hours (kWh) (97percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power six homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Riley Properties LLC purchase and install a 26-kW solar array.Riley Properties owns and operates a commercial building. This project will realize $3,168 per year in savings and will replace 30,631 kWh (98 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to launch the fifth round of its Hub Communities of Achievement Program (HubCAP). This project will provide financial and technical assistance training to five recipient low-income rural communities in West Virginia. These rural communities are recovering from the economic effects of COVID-19. This project will scale up community projects led by local leaders who are seeking technical assistance for increasing local resilience to the impacts of climate change. The recipient community leadership teams will utilize their training to serve the broader beneficiary communities by creating continual and inclusive community engagement and feedback opportunities. They will identify and develop local and regional assets for marketing, business development, and downtown revitalization. This will attract visitors and new residents while retaining population. They will develop long-term capacity to grow and diversify their community and economic development activities. This will enable them to be resilient, responsive, and prepared for any future challenges brought by the effects of climate change on the global economy.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make sewer improvements including approximately 82,000 linear feet of gravity and pressure sewer, approximately 180 grinder pumps, five lift stations, and approximately 16,600 linear feet of transmission force mains. These improvements will provide for a centralized sewer system collecting sewage from the project area and transmitting it to the public service districts existing Camp Conley waste water treatment plant.The package plant at Rolling Acres will be decommissioned, and a new collection system with service reconnects will be provided there.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make sewer improvements including approximately 82,000 linear feet of gravity and pressure sewer, approximately 180 grinder pumps, five lift stations, and approximately 16,600 linear feet of transmission force mains. funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a 2021 Ram 2500 crew cab 4x4 heavy duty, all-purpose pickup truck. The truck will allow the fire department to pull the all-purpose hazmat trailer. The city of Princetons Fire Hazmat Department serves over three square miles of streets and neighborhoods as well as the immediate area outside of the city. There is a mutual aid agreement with the volunteer fire departments, which helps approximately 12,000 additional citizens.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase two 2022 Dodge Durango Pursuit all wheel drive vehicles with custom upgrades. The Princeton Law Enforcement Department has a staff of 21 officers that are full time employees as well as four K-9 units that respond to emergency calls throughout the city, many times in very dangerous circumstances. Overall, the city has 68 employees along with department heads and administrators. The Princeton Law Enforcement Department has staff on duty seven days a week, 24 hours a day to help ensure the safety of the citizens of Princeton.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Mineral County Building Commission to construct a second story to the existing law enforcement office. This will be used as the law enforcement offices and conference/training area. The annex renovation and addition will move the assessors offices, county clerk, and county administration offices to the second floor. The courthouse renovations will provide additional rooms for offices and expand space for the circuit court, circuit judge, county administration, and probation offices. The project also proposes to bring the entire facility up to American Disabilities Act compliance.

borrower_name: POTOMAC VALLEY HOSPITAL OF WVA INC
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to accommodate for COVID-19 equipment needs and reimburse labor expenses directly related to the COVID-19 overflow wing from April to September 2021. Potomac Valley Hospital of WVA Inc. experienced a significant increase in COVID-19 patients during the past 18 months and created an overflow wing to respond to those needs, which took over part of the emergency department and included tents set up in the parking lot. This overflow wing caused a significant strain on the hospital employees and diminished most of their equipment resources.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to hire one full time Vaccination Coordinator and two laboratory technicians to help with the COVID-19 pandemic workload. They will also use funds for various equipment for the pandemic, including a portable blood gas analyzer, portable ultrasound, high-flow nasal cannula, radiographic mobile digital equipment, lab testing equipment, and thermometers. Williamson Health and Wellness Center serves Williamson, Delbarton, Kermit, Matewan, and Gilbert in Mingo County. Williamson Health and Wellness Center has recently purchased the Williamson Memorial Hospital building. This was the only hospital in Mingo County, and it has been closed for over a year. Once internal renovations are complete, the facility will reopen as a fully functioning hospital with an emergency department.

project_name: Waterline Replacement and Water Treatment Plant Rehabilitation Project
funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to address issues with the water system in the eastern Kermit area. They will remove and replace the waterline along U.S. Route 52 to provide water to the east Kermit customers and to create capacity for future growth within and around Kermit. Additionally, this project proposes to upgrade the water treatment plant, which will consist of replacing new high service pumps and controls, upgrading the interior piping, installing a building, and performing miscellaneous electrical upgrades.

borrower_name: West Virginia University Research Corporation on behalf of WVU
funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) TAT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by West Virginia University Research Corporation to provide free training and customized outreach and technical assistance services to small rural water utilities throughout Kentucky, Tennessee, and West Virginia. The Appalachian Community Technical Assistance and Training Program (ACTAT) at West Virginia University works in partnership with University of Kentucky and University of Tennessee Knoxville. ACTAT uses multiple methods of assistance: regional and utility specific training, tailored educational materials, and hands on technical assistance. ACTAT also partners with appropriate experts in engineering, business/management, law, public health, communications, and stakeholder engagement to personalize training and/or technical assistance responses. In 2022-2023 the primary goal is to help small rural communities throughout Central Appalachia sub-regions to improve drinking water and wastewater operations and become eligible to obtain financial resources to improve their vulnerable water infrastructure.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop a comprehensive entrepreneurial support system through various forms of technical assistance to increase the success of early stage small businesses in the form of training, coaching, and business plan creation. A $12,700 applicant contribution will be part of the project as well as a $6,000 third-party match from Greenbrier Valley Economic Development Corporation.

funding_code: DLT CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING - GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to create a controlled atmosphere for operational efficiency and longevity of distance learning network equipment and end-user devices previously funded by USDA. Green Bank Elementary/Middle School in Pocahontas County in West Virginia is located within two distinct radio quiet zones: (1) Radio Astronomy Zoning Act, and (2) National Radio Quiet Zone (NRQZ). In order to minimze harmful interference the equipment funded for this location must be hard wired and shielded. Since this location serves as both a hub and an end user site, 3,000 rural residents will benefit from this project.

funding_code: DLT CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING - GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund equipment to expand the Bridges to Degrees - Dual Enrollment Distant Learning program hosted by Shepherd University in Shepherdstown, West Virginia. Shepherd Universitys main campus and their Tabler Farm location will be the hub sites delivering college credit courses to Berkley Springs High School in Jefferson County and to Washington High School in Morgan County. This project will benefit over 2,000 rural students in a three-year period.

funding_code: DLT CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING - GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to equip four high schools and five middle schools in Raleigh County in North Carolina with tele-presence robots, computers and curriculum. Instructors at the West Virginia University in Monongalia County, NC will deliver Scientific, Technical, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) courses to nine locations benefitting 6,000 students.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop the first floor commercial space into an incubator for two new business ventures and purchase equipment to establish a high-quality, fully functional commercial kitchen. A $500 applicant contribution will be part of the project. A $10,000 third-party match will come from Barbour County Commission as well as $5,000 third-party match will come from the Belington Revitalization Committee.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
naics_description: POURED CONCRETE FOUNDATION AND STRUCTURE CONTRACTORS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems, and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Horsecamp LLC is a family owned excavation business in Harman. Project funds will be used for the purchase and installation of a 10-kW solar array. This project will realize $1,275 per year in savings and will replace 12,751 kWh (47 percent) per year, which is enough electricity to power one home.

funding_code: DISCRETION RURAL MICROPENTERPR DEV ORG
naics_industry_sector: Finance and Insurance (52)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Woodlands Community Lenders Inc., to capitalize a Rural Microloan Revolving Fund to make microloans and provide technical assistance to rural microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Randolph, Barbour and Tucker counties of West Virginia. A borrower contribution of $9,292 will be included in the project.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide financial assistance and training to its recipients. The Housing Authority will provide financial assistance through funding for additional staff or AmeriCorps. They will provide technical assistance by funding consultant services and technical services. The Housing Authority will provide training by sponsoring training workshops locally and paying for recipient staff to attend trainings. In addition, they will offer peer exchanges for recipient groups to share their experiences with one another. This will improve the capacity and ability of the recipients by helping them to carry out pre-development activities for real estate projects that meet pressing community needs for affordable housing, historic preservation, COVID recovery, and alternative energy.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be to update the heating, ventilation and air condition (HVAC) system on its inpatient floor. The current system is from 1970 and does not have a negative air exchange which would allow the air to consistently be drawn out of an infected area and not re-circulated to the rest of the non-infected spaces. By updating this HVAC system to include the negative air exchange on the inpatient floor, the patients hospitalized with infectious diseases would be able to stay on the correct floor without potentially infecting other patients. The hospital is currently using the original air mechanical system from 1970 on the inpatient floor. COVID-19 highlighted the issue of air quality and how air exchange can be an effective infection control tool.

project_name: ROANE CO FAMILY HEALTH ERHC GR
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
naics_description: LESSORS OF OTHER REAL ESTATE PROPERTY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an entryway to Roane County Family Health (RCFH) centers building which will allow the center to separate incoming and outgoing traffic. This project will help better control COVID-19 and other highly contagious diseases. The center is also proposing making the entryway handicap accessible and adding elevators. Currently, RCFH has one entryway door which requires those going in and out to enter and exit through the same door, potentially meeting each other in this confined space. The front entryway is also not handicap accessible.

project_name: Phase I - Wastewater System Improvements Project
funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the City of Grafton to make wastewater system improvements that would include the separation of the sewer system within the drainage shed of CSO-11 and CSO-12. The separation of the sanitary and storm sewer systems would significantly decrease the amount of inflow and infiltration in the collection system. This would not only be a result of the separation of the systems, but the replacement of the sewer system itself would provide a more efficient and tighter sanitary sewer collection system. Separating the systems would lessen the discharge from the issues identified previously and aid the city in lessening the amount of inflow and infiltration that have to be processed by the existing system and treatment facilities.
