funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide both public drinking water and fire protection by extending its water distribution south from Boreman Elementary along Route 18 to Centerville and Alma. The source of the water will be the Davenport Well Field along the Ohio River, which has ample capacity to supply the service area. The water will be pumped through the existing Cow House Hollow Booster Station and through the existing water mains along Route 18, around the Town of Middlebourne, and south. The Public Service District will construct a new booster station at the end of the system. A new storage tank will be constructed to serve this area with drinking water and fire protection. The service area is currently plagued by dry private wells from a poor aquifer that creates water shortages during dry times. There are currently no fire hydrants in the project area. These issues restrict the growth of housing in the area. This project is the second investment that Rural Development has provided on this project. $2,984,000 million (direct loan in the amount of $2,019,000 and grant of $965,000) was provided in July 2021.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve and update noted deficiencies in their system. The project will replace Cow House and Oil Ridge booster stations to make them more efficient while requiring a fraction of the maintenance. Also, the relocation of the Cow House Booster Station will address the erosion issue caused by the adjacent Cow Hollow Run. Several leak points and control issues will be removed through the valve replacement and rebuilds. Twenty valves will be completely replaced and an additional 80 will be rebuilt across the system, primarily in the section called the Route 180 extension. This area was constructed in the early 1990s and the majority of the valves are original. This project will also upgrade seven pressure reducing valves. This work will allow more uptime to be proactive across the system when issues present themselves. The new radio read meters will match the replacements already installed in the system and will eliminate the need to have two incompatible reading devices. The Districts water meters will no longer need to worry about finding support for the antiquated meters currently in their system, since the new meters will be supported by the manufacturer for several years. The electrical upgrades to the Wells Run Well Field will allow the pump motors to run much more efficiently while reducing run time. This extends the working life of the motors.

project_name: Phase VIII Water System Extensions & Improvements
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide 10 waterline extensions. These extensions will reach 166 potential new customers located in currently unserved areas of the public service district and Randolph County. The project will also include several upgrades to the existing distribution system. Two new water booster pump stations and two new water storage tanks will extend water service to the community of Pickens and Metzner Hollow Road. All the other proposed new service areas within the existing district boundary can be served by gravity flow from existing tanks. This subsequent funding will complete the project and extend service to an additional five customers.

project_name: SIDE BY SIDE UTILITY TASK VEHI
funding_code: CY 2022  REGULAR GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a side-by-side utility task vehicle for the fire and rescue purposes of the Belington Volunteer Fire Department (VFD) in Barbour County, West Virginia. The utility task vehicle will be custom outfitted with lights; a siren and radio system; and a firefighting rescue combo kit, which includes a water tank equipped with a fire suppression pump and fire hose, a stokes basket, and first aid supplies. Belington VFD is a completely volunteer-based organization providing 24-hours-per-day public safety and assistance. Having dependable lifesaving equipment is critical for the department to serve its 150-square-mile first-due response area.

funding_code: CY 2022  REGULAR GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES

funding_code: CY 2022  REGULAR GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a vacuum truck for the City of Belington Sewer Department. The sewer vacuum truck will allow regular vacuum cleaning which will extend the lifespan of the entire system. It will also allow for monitoring and evaluation of the sewer system to determine needed upgrades that have been held up due to the lack of not having a truck. The City of Belington sewer system serves over 800 accounts in Barbour County, West Virginia. A sewer vacuum truck is essential to the effectiveness of the Sewer Departments operations in the community.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase 13 V300 model Motorola body-worn cameras. These cameras are compatible with the Barbour County Law Enforcement Departments current radios. This model has built in record-after-the-fact technology that enables the devices to capture important video evidence that can be retrieved hours and days after an incident occurs. These cameras record automatically so officers dont have to manually activate their cameras.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct upgrades to the towns existing water distribution system. Various sized water lines and valves that are approximately 40 years old and require frequent maintenance to correct breaks and leaks will be replaced. Eight fire hydrants will also be replaced, increasing safety and the towns ability to respond to emergencies. The town will continue to purchase its water from neighboring Norton-Harding-Jim town Public Service District.

The project will provide quality outpatient healthcare and wellness services to a service area of approximately 32,200 rural residents.

funding_code: CY 2022 PERSISTENT POVERTY GRANTS DIV N
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: RESCUE AND AMBULANCE SERVICE - EQUIPMENT BUILDING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an ambulance and vehicle for the Clay County Sheriffs Department. The Sheriffs Department and the County Ambulance Service provide service to approximately 8,000 residents, covering a territory of 346 square miles. The Clay County Ambulance Service is currently the only provider in the county and is in need of an additional vehicle to respond to emergencies in a timely manner. The Clay County Sheriffs Department currently operates a very high mileage vehicle that is frequently in need of repairs. Also, many county residents live on secondary roads that are very difficult to access without a four-wheel drive vehicle.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide various upgrades to the town of Romneys water distribution and treatment system. Romney owns and operates a water treatment facility and distribution system providing safe drinking water to customers in Hampshire County, West Virginia. Romney provides potable water to 886 residential and commercial customers, and sells water for resale to the Central Hampshire Public Service District. Approximately three miles of water line will be replaced. Upgrades to the treatment plant include replacement of valves, meters, pumps, and other necessary appurtenances.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
naics_description: LESSORS OF OTHER REAL ESTATE PROPERTY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Hardy County Rural Development Authority to construct a new facility to house the Hardy County Health Department in Moorefield, West Virginia. The proposed facility will be a new 6,000 square foot health clinic with adequate office and work space for the various duties of the health, medical, and patient care services. There will be adequate parking at this site for employees, residents, and customers. The Hardy County Rural Development Authority will lease the facility to the Health Department. The existing facility is leased and shares the building with another operation. There is not adequate space or parking, and the upkeep on the building has been minimal. It was realized during COVID-19 that there was a need for a new building. This additional loan will be used to complete the project.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make upgrades to the wastewater treatment plant and lift stations; conduct a study of system inflow and infiltration; and install a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system for the wastewater collection and treatment system of the town of Wardensville, West Virginia. The system serves 373 households and small businesses within the corporate limits and several adjacent areas. Constructed and put into service in 1976, it is in need of upgrades to continue functioning at an acceptable level.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a new facility that will house the districts main office and maintenance shop. The districts former office and shop facility was severely damaged by flooding during a June 2018 natural disaster. As a result, the district has been forced to operate out of a small temporary construction trailer for the past four years. The site of the facility is a 4.88-acre parcel within the Robert C. Byrd-Hardy County Industrial Park located just outside the eastern city limits of the town of Moorefield. The project will construct a 6,300-square foot building consisting of a 2,000-square foot office area for administrative staff and board members and a 4,300-square foot garage area for maintenance and storage of parts, vehicles, and equipment. A two-hour fire-rated wall will separate the two areas. The building is anticipated to have a useful life of at least 50 years. Building use will be classified as mixed-use occupancy, consisting of business occupancy for the office space and low hazard storage occupancy for the garage area. These additional grant funds will be used to complete the districts main office and maintenance shop project.

funding_code: REAP IRA EEI GRANT $20K AND LESS (FY 23)
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will help 515 E Washington LLC, a commercial real-estate facility located in Jefferson County, purchase and install a 17-kW solar array. This project will realize $951 per year in savings and will generate 19,214 kWh per year (100 percent of energy being replaced), which is enough electricity to power more than one home.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install an 84 kilowatt (kW) solar array at River Riders Inc., an adventure resort in Jefferson County. This project will realize $3,587 per year in savings and will replace 97,022 kilowatt hours (kWh) per year, which is enough electricity to power eight homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP IRA RES GRANT UNRESTRICTED (FY 22/23)
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 87 kilowatt (kW) solar array at 126 Building LLC, an investment firm in Jefferson County. This project will generate 87,634 kilowatt hours (kWh) (50 percent), which is enough electricity to power seven homes.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 13.2-kW solar array. Cobb & Associates is a construction consulting business located in Jefferson County. This project will realize $1,859 per year in savings and will generate 17,760 kWh per year (95 percent of previous use), which is enough electricity to power two homes.

funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS

Their effort will include developing energy assessments and supporting small businesses in applying for REAP grant funding.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase two law enforcement vehicles to replace some of its aging fleet. The two vehicles purchased will be custom outfitted as cruisers with lights, consoles, and brackets to hold radio equipment for law enforcement use. The city of Westons Police Department currently employs six officers and has a fleet of four cruisers. The department provides public safety and law enforcement assistance 24 hours per day. Having dependable life saving equipment is critical for the department to serve the city of 4,110 residents at a moments notice. Police cruisers are essential to the effectiveness of its operations in the community. This additional funding will complete the purchase of the police vehicles.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the Mason County Public Service District sewer system. The project includes approximately 82,000 linear feet of gravity and pressure sewer; 180 grinder pumps; five lift stations; and 16,600 linear feet of transmission force main. It will provide a centralized sewer system collecting and transmitting from the project area to the districts Camp Conley wastewater treatment plant. The package plant at Rolling Acres will be decommissioned and a replacement collection system with service reconnects will be built.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (GRANT ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to convert the Town of Bradshaws waste water system to a traditional gravity system. This project will consolidate the majority of the customers onto centralized pumping stations for system efficiency and energy savings. The existing multiple high maintenance, high energy consumption grinder pumps and vacuum stations will be removed. The system is a hybrid compilation of multiple technologies that suffers from high energy consumption, regular component malfunctions, infiltration, and excessive staff time requirements. The system was completed in the mid-1990s, and both the lines and the plant have exceeded their useful life expectancy.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WASTE ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to prepare a preliminary engineering report (PER) and environmental report (ER) for the McDowell County Public Service District to provide public sewer service alternatives in and near the cities Keystone and Northfork, West Virginia. The project is part of the USDA and EPA national initiative Closing the Wastewater Gap.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct various upgrades to the City of Williamsons water treatment, storage, and distribution systems. The project will install new high service pumps and filter media at the treatment system. The project will construct approximately 15,100 feet of 24-inch and smaller diameter water mains, a 500-gallons-per-minute booster pump station, and four new water storage tanks of varying capacity. In addition, the project will rehabilitate a 300,000-gallon water storage tank and install numerous pressure-reducing stations and back-up generators for the treatment plant and booster pump station.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay the salary of the College Store and Rural Business Incubators business manager. The incubator will support and sell products from student entrepreneurs and other producers. The applicant is contributing $19,362 to the project.

borrower_name: West Virginia University Research Corporation on behalf of WVU
funding_code: (WWA PROGRAM AREA) TAT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide free customized outreach and technical assistance to small rural water utilities throughout Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia. West Virginia University and prior National Environmental Services Center staff will direct the project in close collaboration with the University of Kentucky, University of Tennessee-Knoxville, and Virginia Tech with input from state and regional regulatory agencies and other service providers. ACTAT uses multiple methods of assistance to support water utilities: regional and utility-specific training, tailored educational materials, and hands-on technical assistance. In 2023-2024, the ACTAT Program will continue to provide traditional technical assistance and training with an increased focus on supporting disadvantaged communities and promoting resilience.

funding_code: TELEMEDICINE- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to equip one hub site and 11 end-user sites throughout Cabell, Lincoln, and Mason counties in Southwestern West Virginia and Gallia County in Southeastern Ohio with telemedicine equipment. Medical professionals at Cabell Huntington Hospital in Huntington, West Virginia will deliver Critical Care, Neurology, Nephrology, Endocrine and Behavioral / Mental health care services to 11 locations benefitting 26,232 individuals.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to equip one hub/end-user site in Gilmer County in Central West Virginia with Wi-Fi infrastructure upgrades, computer labs, and audio/video conferencing equipment. Instructors at Glenville State University (GSU) in Gilmer County, West Virginia will deliver academic and non-academic instructional content online to GSU students expanding access to mental health counseling via telehealth programs benefitting 1,500 students.

funding_code: DLT GRANTS - SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER - EDUCATIONAL
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to equip nine hub sites and nine end-user sites throughout Mingo county in southwest West Virginia with distance learning equipment. Instructors in the Mingo County School District in Mingo County, West Virginia will deliver standardized curriculum for and all classes in the district, science, technology, engineering and mathematics and career development courses to nine locations benefitting 3,919 students.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to deploy fiber-to-the-home broadband service in rural West Virginia. The funded service areas include 2,360 households, two educational facilities, and seven essential community facilities spread over 55 square miles.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to deploy a Fiber-to-the-Premise (FTTP) broadband network in rural areas of West Virginia. The service areas include 6,320 households, five educational facilities, and one critical community facility spread over 355 square miles.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to allow Ohio Valley Industrial and Business Development Corporation toconstruct a fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) network utilizing gigabit passive optical network (GPON) technologies in rural West Virginia. The funded service areas include 1,909 households, five educational facilities, one health care center, and nine critical community facilities spread over 48 square miles.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND COST OVERRUN GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide additional financing to provide Tyler County Development Authority, Inc. with the opportunity to provide broadband service to underserved households, farms and businesses in Tyler County, West Virginia. The funded service area includes 1,366 households, three educational facilities, one health care center, and five critical community facilities spread over 26 square miles.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the sewer collection system for the town of Triadelphia, West Virginia. There are 50 damaged system-line locations needing repair. The project also will replace and repair various service lateral lines, manholes, and features. The collection system currently has excessive inflow and infiltration causing a range of costly environmental issues. The project will provide the town with a collection system substantially less prone to inflow and infiltration.

The project is part of the USDA and EPA national initiative Closing the Wastewater Gap.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the German Ridge and Dickson areas of the Northern Distribution System to an eight-inch waterline to better serve the systems customers with fire flow, reduced water loss, and reduced operation and maintenance costs associated with leak repairs. The project will also install Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) additions, automatic flushing equipment, tank cleaning, and installation of tank mixers. The mapping of the entire Northern Distribution System will provide additional security and reduce the time associated with locating problems within the distribution system. These additional funds will complete this project.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a roof mounted 198 kilowatt (kW) photovoltaic solar array on this small business in Wood County. Electricity from this solar array will be sold to the Polymer Alliance Zone through a Power Purchase Agreement which will help to offset up to 61 percent of the electricity purchased from the grid for this specific facility. It is expected the solar array will generate 277,312 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually of renewable electricity which is equivalent to 23 typical U.S. households.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses to develop renewable energy systems, and to make energy-efficient improvements to their operations. Conrad Farms is a poultry farm in Pendleton County. Project funds will purchase and install more energy-efficient grain drying and storage equipment and improved moisture and temperature regulation. This project will realize $3,727 per year in savings and will save 58,594 kWh per year (32 percent), which is enough electricity to power four homes.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Hospital Development Company (doing business as Roane General Hospital) to remodel and update the inpatient floor of the hospital. Issues with the heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) system were discovered during COVID because the air flow was unable to be contained to each room with the current HVAC. The hospital created homemade negative air flow rooms for those with COVID to keep the contaminated air to each room. These funds will be used to update the HVAC for the whole floor so that those with infectious diseases can have the airflow contained per room. Other minor updates will also be done on the inpatient floor while they are working on updating the duct work.

naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 72.27 kilowatt (kW) solar array. Valley Scenic View offers cabin rentals in Tucker County, West Virginia. This project will generate 76,606 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually, which is enough electricity to power six homes.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to enlarge and renovate the third-floor courtroom of the Wayne County Courthouse. Wayne County Building Commission will also renovate offices and connected areas that are used with the courtroom. These improvements will include security and handicap accessibility.
